work.name: VoltStorage GmbH
work.summary:
Head of IT at CleanTech Start-up, leader of a team of 3. Software Architect, Project Manager & Engineer.
Node.js, React, Embedded C++.

work.name: Daimler AG
work.summary:
Research methods for improving perceived quality of service (QoS) of Online
Services in modern luxury vehicles. Specifically, development of strategies to
offer online services in the car while a very slow or no internet connection at all
is available.

work.name: salomatic
work.summary: Full-Stack Web development, Ruby on Rails, React, PostgreSQL

work.name: Rentino Rio GmbH
work.summary: First intern, then working student (on & off, ~2 months per year). Java, JSP, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

projects.description:
React-based web platform for VoltStorage employees & partners. Offers product monitoring, troubleshooting, battery installation support, statistics, firmware updates, setting changes and much more.

My role: Architect, Lead Engineer
projects.name: VoltStorage Admin Interface

projects.description:
Google Chrome extension adding touch controls to the virtual tabletop service "Roll20". Registers touch input (from fingers or pens) and simulates the corresponding mouse & keyboard commands for the underlying system.

One of my hobby projects. I am the sole developer.
projects.name: Touch20

projects.description:
Customer-facing progressive WebApp. Fully responsive, live & historic data display for owned batteries & other power-related household metrics.

My role: Architect, Lead Engineer
projects.name: VoltStorage App

projects.description:
A server-side application providing a REST-API plus a WebSocket API for real-time data transfer. Acts as a management application for the company's fleet of smart home batteries. Manages per-battery settings, provides over-the-air updates, receives, processes and stores real-time data from all products (1 Hz), aggregates statistics and much more.

Node.js-based. Uses MongoDB for real-time data & PostgreSQL for everything else.

My role: Architect, Lead Engineer
projects.name: VoltStorage Backend

projects.description:
Microcontroller firmware for VoltStorage's smart home batteries. Based on Espressif's ESP32 chip, programmed in C++. IoT project with low-level hardware interaction, secure server communication & over-the-air updates on a severely resource-constrained device (we're talking 520 kB of RAM).

My role: Architect, Lead Engineer
projects.name: VoltStorage Firmware

projects.description:
Battery Management System for a high-voltage tractive system battery used in an electric race car. Based on an STM32 microcontroller, this system continuously monitors voltage & temperature of every single one of the 140 cells in the battery pack. Emergency shutdown functionality. Manages balanced battery charging. Calculates the state of charge.

My role: Lead Software Developer
projects.name: Elefant Racing BMS

projects.description:
Developed an online character sheet for a Pen & Paper role playing system set in the world of Bethesda's "Elder Scrolls: Morrowind". 

Tech: Ruby on Rails, AngularJS. I am the sole developer & maintainer
projects.name: Morrowind Pen & Paper

projects.description:
Software for an ECU (electronics control unit) of an electric race car. Based on a Linux-powered single-board computer this software manages all vehicle functions from throttle input to inverter output. Real time capable with 1000 Hz sample rate. Live telemetry system via WiFi & ZigBee radio. Sensor input & vehicle dynamics controls (recuperation, traction control, launch control).

This was my Bachelor Thesis. I was the sole developer & designer.
projects.name: Elefant Racing Ebox

projects.description:
Data analysis & telemetry software. First use case were Formula Student race cars but Elemetry continued to be used in a multitude of environments. Home-grown graph renderer capable of displaying millions of data points with axis-independent zoom in real time. Based on Java and JavaFx.

My Role: Lead Developer, manager of up to 4 team members.
projects.name: Elemetry

basics.personalDescription:
I am a software enthusiast.

That covers it pretty well. But to give you some details:

I am a software engineer. I love to design & implement solutions for complex IT problems. I design software systems to be prepared for change instead of fearing change. Security and efficiency are of utmost importance to me.

I am an expert programmer. I learned to code in my teenage years and went on to teach myself language after language, technology after technology. I strive for clean and efficient solutions. Automated testing is second nature to me and I use Test-Driven Development whenever possible.

I am versatile. I've worked professionally in various fields - including Real-Time Embedded Systems, Database Engineering, Full-Stack Web Development, App Development and server management and administration. In addition, I am no stranger to electronics, engineering, business processes and conducting interviews.

I am a leader. I combine technical competence with the social skills required to lead and motivate a team - all this while listening to the wishes, needs and suggestions from the team members. I am willing and able to make tough decisions and I take the blame for my failures.

I am not a scientist. I am not someone who invents new algorithms on a world-class level.
